TITLE: The pandemic has widened the gap between women and men's retirement savings. What to know about catching up
SUMMARY: Only 19% of women are confident they're on track to retire without running out of money, according to TIAA. That's compared to 35% of men.

TITLE: Here’s the average tax refund so far this year — and the 3 best places to stash yours
SUMMARY: A tax refund offers a rare opportunity to build a safety net. Here are three ways to stretch the one-time payment.

TITLE: How to avoid a 6-figure tax penalty on foreign bank accounts
SUMMARY: If you have overseas financial accounts, you may need to disclose balances to the U.S. Department of the Treasury by April 15 or incur a steep tax penalty.

TITLE: The SEC climate rule: 7 things investors need to know
SUMMARY: The Securities and Exchange Commission unveiled a rule around climate disclosures companies make to their investors. It could have far-reaching effects.

TITLE: Higher-education expert proposes new way for Biden to cancel student debt without Congress
SUMMARY: Higher-education expert Mark Kantrowitz argues federal student loans could be forgiven via regulatory changes set by the executive branch.

TITLE: Consumers felt the pinch at the pump with rising gas prices in February. Here's who was affected the most
SUMMARY: Rising gas, rental and grocery costs have had the biggest effect on households with $50,000 or less in annual income, according to a new report.

TITLE: Assisted living communities average more than $4,000 monthly. This is where they are the most and least costly
SUMMARY: There can be big differences in the cost of assisted living facilities, depending on where the community is located.

TITLE: There’s a tricky cryptocurrency question on your tax return. 'You’re playing with fire if you don’t report it.'
SUMMARY: The IRS has issued a warning about how to answer the cryptocurrency question on the front page of your tax return. Here's how to respond correctly.

TITLE: Department of Education says owners of troubled private colleges will be on the hook for costs to taxpayers
SUMMARY: The U.S. Department of Education says it will hold the owners of certain colleges that closed or defrauded students accountable for taxpayer losses.

TITLE: Florida just became the largest state to mandate personal finance education in high school
SUMMARY: On Tuesday, Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis signed bill SB 1054, which mandates personal finance education for high school graduation.

TITLE: Op-ed: Investors should look at technology, health care and industrials for long-term investing potential
SUMMARY: A rocky start to 2022 has unnerved investors but three sectors — tech, health care and industrials — offer a lot of opportunity.

TITLE: Two states are temporarily suspending their gas taxes and others could follow. But don't expect big savings
SUMMARY: As two states put temporary gas tax holidays in place, savings may be limited. Plus, it won't help price pressures from inflation and Russia-Ukraine conflict.

TITLE: Investing in the stock market is more important than ever amid rising inflation
SUMMARY: Investing in equities is generally a good way to outrun inflation. However, some investors may be put off by current choppy markets.

TITLE: Inflation is spiking the cost of pet parenthood yet owners are still splurging on care
SUMMARY: More than 70% of dog owners are feeling the sting of inflation when spending on food and supplies. But many are still willing to splurge, a report shows.

TITLE: The Great Resignation continues, as 44% of workers look for a new job
SUMMARY: Higher pay was the top reason workers said they'd take another job, according to a survey. Health benefits, job security and flexible work are also factors.

TITLE: Financial advisors are still reluctant to use cryptocurrencies. Investor demand may change that
SUMMARY: About 45% of advisors expect to use cryptocurrencies in the future in response to client requests, according to a report from Cerulli Associates.

TITLE: Odds are, you’re better off buying an index fund. Here’s why
SUMMARY: The returns of four out of five actively managed U.S. stock funds lagged in 2021, according to S&P Dow Jones Indices.

TITLE: There are 4 weeks until the tax deadline. What filers need to know
SUMMARY: There are four weeks until the federal tax deadline, which is April 18 for most Americans. Here's what to know if you haven't filed.

TITLE: Op-ed: Why investors should care about who owns their advisor's firm
SUMMARY: There are many factors to consider when selecting a financial advisor, from acumen to personal chemistry. Also important: who actually owns the advisor's firm.

TITLE: Buying your first home? Here's what you need to know
SUMMARY: People looking to buy a home for the first time face a steep learning curve. Here are some of the basics from experts in the field.

TITLE: How older workers can push back against the reality of ageism
SUMMARY: How older workers can push back against ageism

TITLE: Meet Erin Collins, National Taxpayer Advocate for the IRS
SUMMARY: Erin Collins, the national taxpayer advocate, fights for systemic changes within the IRS. Here’s what to know about the Taxpayer Advocate Service.

TITLE: She lost everything in a fire. Then her bank froze the savings she needed to move on
SUMMARY: Siraba Keita's experience reflects a tension between banks, their customers and creditors looking to collect on old debts.

TITLE: A record number of weddings are expected this year. How to save if you’re planning a trip down the aisle
SUMMARY: The most weddings since 1984 are expected to take place this year. If you're getting married, there are ways you can trim higher costs.

TITLE: The IRS has delivered more than 45 million tax refunds. This is the average payment
SUMMARY: The IRS has issued more than 45 million refunds worth almost $152 billion, as of March 11. Here's the average payment.

TITLE: Why high gas prices fall harder on lower earners
SUMMARY: Lower-income households spend more of their budgets on transportation and other necessities relative to other income groups, according to economists.

TITLE: Tax return backlog will ‘absolutely’ clear by end of 2022, says IRS Commissioner Charles Rettig
SUMMARY: IRS Commissioner Charles Rettig told House lawmakers he expects the backlog of tens of millions of unprocessed tax returns to clear by the end of 2022.

TITLE: Flexible hours allow employees at this company to fit work around their lives
SUMMARY: Americans crave flexibility in the workplace. This tech company has it. Here's how it works and how one employee used  it to her advantage.

TITLE: 46% of taxpayers plan to save their refunds this year
SUMMARY: So far, the average tax refund is $3,401, nearly 14% higher than last year, according to the IRS.

TITLE: Mom or dad moving in? What to know about becoming a caregiver
SUMMARY: If you are on the verge of becoming a caregiver for your older parent, here are some tips for managing the transition.
